title: SoftwareModule
description: This element represents a commercial, or open-source Software, script, macro, plugin or module utilized for any Image Acquisition, Image Analysis or Quality Control task.

subCategoriesOrder.ManufacturerSpec: This describes the Manufacturer specifications for this component (i.e., Manufacturer Name, Model designation and Catalog Number).
subCategoriesOrder.SoftwareModule: This element represents a commercial, or open-source Software, script, macro, plugin or module utilized for any Image Acquisition, Image Analysis or Quality Control task.

Name.description: This field records the Name or any other designation the Author uses for this Software.

ID.description: A Unique Identifier for this component.

Version.description: This field records the Version of this Software.

Author.description: This field records the developer of this Software. This could be the Manufacturer if this is a commercial proprietary sofware or the Author(s) if this is an open-source software.

WebsiteURL.description: This field records the URL address of any Website where the Software can be obtained. In case of open-source Software this field should record the URL for the Git repository from which to obtain the source-code.

PrimaryPublicationID.description: This field captures the a Unique Identifier for the Primary Publication describing this Software. Examples include, Digital Object Identifier (DOI), PubMed Central Identifier (PMCID), ArXiv.org ID etc.

OpenSource.description: This records whether this Software is OpenSource (True) or proprietary (False).

Macro.description: This field records whether this Software is a Macro or a Scprit (True) or is it a full free-standing program.

Build.description: The specific build of this Software.

Patch.description: This recodes the version for an optional Patch, HotFix or Update used for this Sofware to run this Instrument. A Patch (aka HotFix, or Update) is a set of changes to a computer program or its supporting data designed to update, fix, or improve it. This includes fixing security vulnerabilities, and other bugs, with such patches usually being called bugfixes or bug fixes, and improving the functionality, usability or performance.

ReleaseDate.description: The date in which this Software was resleased.

Language.description: This records the computer Language in which this Software was developed.

Manufacturer.description: This field refers to the company, research group or individual who manufactured this hardware component.

Model.description: This field refers to the Model name or any other designation the Manufacturer uses for this component.

CatalogNumber.description: This field records the Catalog, Part or Serial Number used by the Manufacturer to uniquely identify this component.

LotNumber.description: The Lot Number used by the Manufacturer to refer to a specific production batch or lot for this component.

items.description: This empty element refers to any existing Software Module that was used in association with this Instrument.

Description.title: Description
Description.description: This element holds a simple multi-line comment or annotation describing this component.

Tier.description: The tier level of this component.
